Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, human, primates, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (42.86%) toHuman alpha-synucleinV: 17%, A: 15%, G: 13%, K: 18% (R: 0%).Activity: active against Gram- bacteria  E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 1.6 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 15692 (MIC 1.6 uM), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 3.3 uM), S. epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC 3.2 uM), yeast C. albicans (MIC 6.4 uM), F. neoformans (MIC 6.4 uM), mold A. flavus (MIC 6.4 uM), R. solani (MIC 12.8 uM).SAR: the activity of alpha-synuclein(61-140) reported >25.6 uM, i.e., either not active or at most weakly active against the tested strains.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: expressed and purified for testing.
Literature Information.Author: Park SC, Moon JC, Shin SY, Son H, Jung YJ, Kim NH, Kim YM, Jang MK, Lee JR. 2016
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2016 Sep 16;478(2):924-8. doi: 10.1016/j.bbrc.2016.08.052.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Functional characterization of alpha-synuclein protein with antimicrobial activity.
